TopicTitle: Something to do while passing time 'til .24

Articles.Content:
Ahhhhh! It's like waiting for Christmas as a child, terrible.

I'm not sure how to pronounce it, but I was about to go O-U-T S-I-D-E whatever that is, when I realized Orbital Sciences was launching an Antares Space station resupply mission today. Ordinarily I don't bring launches up 'cause they sometimes don't go as planned or someone else posts it, but I don't see it anywhere here (sorry if I missed it) so here you go. The weather looks beautiful. Here's hoping the spacecraft functions within acceptable parameters and we don't have to 'revert to VAB'.

For some reason the NASA feed is always buffering. Space.com works better.

Fingers crossed.

Go private space industry!

http://www.space.com/17933-nasa-television-webcasts-live-space-tv.html

Edited July 13, 2014 by Aethon
